授業目的: The purpose of this course is to introduce 1st year students to the origins and historical development of Christianity, its presence in the world today, the Bible, and some Christian theology and language and expressions of Christian faith. Students will also learn about Christianity's influence on societies and social justice movements past and present and be exposed to the spirit and ideals for establishing Kwansei Gakuin and its history. Kwansei Gakuin University is a Christian university, founded in 1889 by Rev. Walter Russell Lambuth, a missionary of the Southern Methodist Episcopal Church in the United States. Ever since its founding, Kwansei Gakuin University has educated its students based on the principles of Christianity. The Christiantiy A&B introductory courses have been important parts of our education.
到達目標:
1.    to become knowledgeable about the origin and historical development of Christianity;

2.    to become knowledgeable about some Christian foundations – beliefs, practices, values and ethics;

3.    to become knowledgeable about Christianity’s presence and influence in today’s world and some ministries;

4.    to become knowledgeable about the spirit and ideals of Kwansei Gakuin for student life present and in the future.
授業方法: In-person lectures, readings, writings, discussions, and presentations, with two guest speakers (Zoom or in-person)

第1回: Week 1: Introduction – Course overview, purpose, and class expectations; sharing of one another’s cultural and religious backgrounds; exploring some basics; and an invitation to journaling/reflections.   (In-class written assignment #1 – to hand in at the end of class)
第2回: Week 2: Christianity from its roots: Judaism and the Hebrew Bible / Old Testament    (In-class assignment #2 by group – to share in class)
Reading for class will be assigned in early April.
第3回: Week 3: The origins of Christianity - Jesus of Nazareth (short quiz)
Reading for class will be assigned in early April.
第4回: Week 4: The Christian Bible and the four gospels (In-class assignment #3 – to hand in at the end of class)
Reading for class will be assigned in early April.
第5回: Week 5: Christian teachings: Focus on Jesus’ parables (In-class assignment #4 by group – to present in class)
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第6回: Week 6: Christian Creeds and Beliefs; Kwansei Gakuin history and values (short quiz)
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第7回: Week 7: In-class Mid-term test
第8回: Week 8: Early church formation – Paul’s travels and letters, plus more
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第9回: Week 9: The Middle Ages and the Renaissance c500-1500
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第10回: Week 10: The Reformation c1500 – 1650 and into the Modern era c1650-1914
Reading for class will be assigned in June.
第11回: Week 11: Christianity in the 20th and 21st century – 1914 to present and the “missional church”
Reading for class will be assigned in June.
第12回:
Week 12: Christianity – Canadian and North American contexts, with guest lecturer: Indigenous leadership (virtual): Rev. Mary Fontaine, Director of Hummingbird Ministries, Presbytery of Westminster, the Presbyterian Church in Canada*

*date may change due to speaker availability

Week 13: Christianity – Canadian and North American contexts, with guest lecturer: Intercultural leadership (virtual): Rev. Hyuk Cho, Associate Professor and Director of United Church Faith Formation and Studies, Vancouver School of Theology, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada*
